FuncDef:
The web response-error-id enable command enables the device to send an Access-Reject packet with an error code to the Portal server.
The undo web response-error-id enable command disables the device from sending an Access-Reject packet with an error code to the Portal server.
By default, the device sends an Access-Reject packet without an error code to the Portal server.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a user is not authenticated to access the NE40E in web authentication mode, the device sends an Access-Reject packet to the Portal server. If the user wants the Access-Reject packet to carry an error code indicating the error type, run the web response-error-id enable command.
Definitions of common error codes as below:
AC101:The IP address requested by a user is a valid IP address in the address pool of the BRAS but is already authenticated and in use.AC102:The IP address requested by a user is not a valid IP address in the address pool of the BRAS.AC103:The IP address requested by a user is a valid IP address in the address pool of the BRAS but is not yet assigned to the user.AC201:The communication between the BRAS and RADIUS server times out or a fault occurs on the communication network.RADIUS error code, such as RD101:A RADIUS error code, such as RD101, in an Access-Reject packet sent by the RADIUS server to the BRAS is inserted in the ErrID field and transparently transmitted to the Portal server.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
